Stem: Upright or spread outwards with upright tips.
Flowers: Greyish green to whitish, feathery,at tips of head, branching from same point.
FruitSeeds: Hairy spikelets which leave 2 bracts when they fall off.
Habitat: Agricultural land, bare ground, disturbed areas, roadsides, creek lines.
DistinguishingFeatures: Easily confused with other Chloris species, best chance is combination of characteristics.
